properties.name: allowEditing
properties.summary: Specifies if the media should be editable after capture/selection.

properties.name: allowMultiple
properties.summary: Specifies if the user should be able to select multiple photos.
properties.description: The allowMultiple property is only available on Android API 18 and above.

properties.name: allowTranscoding
properties.summary: Specifies if the video should be transcoded (using highest quality preset) . If set to false no video transcoding will be performed.

properties.name: animated
properties.summary: Specifies if the dialog should be animated upon showing and hiding.

properties.name: arrowDirection
properties.summary: Controls the type of arrow and position of the popover.

properties.name: autohide
properties.summary: Specifies if the photo gallery should be hidden automatically after the media selection is completed.

properties.name: cancel
properties.summary: Function to call if the user presses the cancel button.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Function to call upon receiving an error.

properties.name: mediaTypes
properties.summary:
Array of media type constants to allow.

Live photos is only supported on the iOS platform, starting with iOS 9.1. If you want to allow live photos with MEDIA_TYPE_LIVEPHOTO, you also need to specify at least MEDIA_TYPE_PHOTO as a fallback. If you do not allow live photos, they still can be selected, but will be represented as a normal static photo.

properties.name: popoverView
properties.summary: View to position the photo gallery popover on top of.

properties.name: selectionLimit
properties.summary: Specifies number of media item that can be selected.
properties.description: Setting this property to zero allows you to select maximum number of media supported by system. This will work only when <Titanium.Media.allowMultiple> is true.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Function to call when the photo gallery is closed after a successful selection.
properties.description: If <Titanium.Media.allowMultiple> is true, then CallbackCameraMediaMultipleItemsType will be invoked. Otherwise CallbackCameraMediaItemType will be invoked for single selection.
